greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lower triangular matrix, read by rows: T(i,j) = number of ways i seats can be occupied by any number k (0<=k<=j<=i) of persons.
comment: T(m, n) gives the number of matchings in the complete bipartite graph K_{m,n}. - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Apr 25 2017
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10011 (rows 1 to 141, flattened)
Ed Jones, Number of seatings, discussion in newsgroup sci.math, Aug 9, 2003.
R. J. Mathar, The number of binary nxm matrices with at most k 1's in each row or columns, Table 1.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Complete Bipartite Graph
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Independent Edge Set
Index entries for sequences related to Laguerre polynomials
formula: The role of seats and persons may be interchanged, so T(i, j)=T(j, i).
T(i, j) = j!*LaguerreL(j, i-j, -1). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Aug 25 2003
T(i, j) = Sum_{k=0..j} k!*binomial(i, k)*binomial(j, k). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Aug 25 2003
example: T(2,1)=a(2)=3: 00,10,01 (both seats empty, left seat occupied, right seat occupied).
mathematica: Table[Table[Sum[k! Binomial[n, k] Binomial[j, k], {k, 0, j}], {j, 1, n}], {n, 1, 10}] // Grid (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Jul 09 2015 *)
Table[m! LaguerreL[m, n - m, -1], {n, 10}, {m, n}] // Flatten (* _Eric W. Weisstein_, Apr 25 2017 *)
program: (Sage) flatten([[factorial(k)*gen_laguerre(k, n-k, -1) for k in [1..n]] for n in (1..10)]) # _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 23 2021
(Magma) [Factorial(k)*Evaluate(LaguerrePolynomial(k, n-k), -1): k in [1..n], n in [1..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 23 2021
(PARI) T(i, j) = j!*pollaguerre(j, i-j, -1); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 23 2021
xref: Diagonal: A002720, first subdiagonal: A000262, 2nd subdiagonal: A052852, 3rd subdiagonal: A062147, 4th subdiagonal: A062266, 5th subdiagonal: A062192, 2nd row/column: A002061. With column 0: A176120.
